perturbation.original_text: the Company shall present to Lessor documentation ("Purchase Documentation"), in form and substance satisfactory to Lessor in its sole discretion, which (i) describes all units of Equipment ordered, received and accepted by the Company as agent for Lessor in connection with such Schedule, and (ii) if Company has paid any Supplier for any of the Equipment, includes evidence of the Purchase Price paid to Supplier for each such unit of Equipment and of passage of title thereto to Lessor. Upon the latter of (A) Lessor's receipt of the Purchase Documentation or (B) the satisfaction of all conditions precedent on or after the applicable Lease Commencement Date, Lessor shall pay the Supplier or reimburse the Company, as the case may be, for the aggregate Purchase Price for all Equipment purchased hereunder in connection with such schedule.
perturbation.changed_text: the Company shall present to Lessor documentation (“Purchase Documentation”) which describes all units of Equipment ordered, received and accepted by the Company as agent for Lessor in connection with such Schedule. Upon Lessor's receipt of the Purchase Documentation, Lessor may pay the Supplier or reimburse the Company for Equipment purchased hereunder in connection with such schedule.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates specific documentation requirements and Lessor's obligation to pay upon fulfillment. The modified clause removes Lessor's obligation to pay, introducing ambiguity. The original clause mandates specific documentation requirements. The modified clause significantly weakens Lessor's obligation to pay, making it discretionary and removing requirements for Purchase Price evidence. This could potentially allow Lessor to delay or deny payment without clear justification, creating a legal risk for suppliers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract, Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - regarding good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: So long as no default exists and is continuing hereunder or under the Lease, either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon ____________ (______30________) days written notice to the other party; provided however that such termination shall not act as a termination of any Equipment leased hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time, and such termination shall act as a termination of any Equipment leased hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires 30 days' notice for termination and ensures that the termination of the agency agreement does not affect existing equipment leases. The modified clause removes the notice period and states that termination will terminate equipment leases, potentially violating lease agreements that are still in effect. This creates potential breach of contract issues, especially if equipment leases have specific terms and conditions regarding early termination penalties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract, specific clauses in the Master Lease Agreement

perturbation.original_text: In the event the Company is in default hereunder or under the Lease, Lessor may elect to terminate this Agreement immediately, which shall be effective upon the receipt of written notice thereof by the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event the Company is in default hereunder, Lessor may terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates a written notice for termination in case of default by the Company. The modified clause removes the requirement for written notice, thus potentially violating standard legal practices and fairness principles, where a notice and cure period are usually provided. The omission also increases legal risks because lack of written notice can lead to disputes over whether the termination was justified and properly communicated.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding notice and cure periods for defaults.
